intro: Leichhardtia praestans, commonly known as the showy leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and its clusters of showy, pinkish-white flowers. It produces small, round, woody fruits that contain seeds. Leichhardtia praestans is often found in heathlands and rocky soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
